sen.j: 塩焼王（しおやきのおおきみ、生年不詳 - 764年10月21日（天平宝字8年9月18日 (旧暦)））は、天武天皇の孫で、新田部親王の子。
sen.e: Prince Shioyaki (Year of birth unknown - October 21, 764) was a grandchild of Emperor Tenmu and a child of Imperial Prince Niitabe.

sen.e: He was a third generation Imperial family member whose lawful wife was Imperial Princess Fuwa, Princess (older paternal half-sister of Empress Koken) of Emperor Shomu.

sen.e: In the selection of a successor to Prince Funado (Funado no Okimi), the deposed Crown Prince in 757, he was not installed as Crown Prince even though he was recommended by FUJIWARA no Toyonari and FUJIWARA no Nagate.

sen.j: 橘奈良麻呂の乱では、天皇に担ぎ出されようとした為、配流に処されそうになったが、特赦により免罪される。
sen.e: In the revolt of TACHIBANA no Naramaro, he was threatened to be put up for Emperor, due to which he was on the point of being exiled, however he was acquitted under an amnesty.

sen.j: 後名誉回復し、翌年に臣籍降下し氷上真人の姓氏を賜るが、一族の多くが政治的な混乱に巻き込まれている。
sen.e: Afterward, he retrieved his lost honor and in the following year, was given a family name of HIKAMI no Mahito being demoted from nobility to commoner, however, many of his family members were caught up in the political confusion.

sen.e: There was a possibility that Prince Shioyaki succeed to the Imperial Throne in view of the facts that he was husband of Imperial Princess Fuwa, a Princess of Emperor Shomu, that Prince Shioyaki himself was a grandchild of Emperor Tenmu and that he was supported by such members of the Fujiwara clan as Toyonari and Nagate.

sen.j: 764年、皮肉にもかつて塩焼王の皇位継承を阻んだその藤原仲麻呂（恵美押勝）に擁立されて天皇となるべく反乱（藤原仲麻呂の乱）を起こす。
sen.e: In 764, he raised a rebellion (Rebellion of Fujiwara no Nakamaro) to succeed to the throne being helped, ironically, by FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (EMI no Oshikatsu) who had once obstructed a possible succession of Prince Shioyaki to the Imperial Throne.
